text: Richard James Cushing (August 24, 1895 â€“ November 2, 1970) was an American prelate of the Roman Catholic Church. He was Archbishop of Boston from 1944 to 1970 and was made a cardinal in 1958. Cushing died of cancer on November 2, 1970 in Boston, Massachusetts at the age of 75. ==References== Category:1895 births Category:1970 deaths Category:American cardinals Category:People from Boston
title: Richard Cushing
